Utterance: Hi! It’s good to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been okay. I tried the bedtime routine, and it helped a bit.
That’s wonderful to hear! How many nights did you manage to stick to it?
I did it four nights out of the week. I still woke up a couple of times, but I felt more relaxed going to bed.
That’s progress! It’s great that you’re taking steps to improve your sleep. Did you notice any difference in how you felt during the day?
Yes, I felt a bit more energized, which was nice.
That’s fantastic! How about your social interactions? Did you have any gatherings that you practiced your skills at?
Yes, I went to another small get-together, and I tried to engage more. I felt a little less anxious this time.
That’s a great sign! What do you think contributed to that decrease in anxiety?
I think practicing the breathing exercises helped. I also reminded myself that it’s okay not to be perfect.
Excellent! It sounds like you’re really starting to implement those strategies. Have you found any particular thoughts or situations that still trigger your anxiety?
I still get nervous when I think about meeting new people. It makes me want to avoid those situations altogether.
That’s common. We can work on exposure techniques, which involve gradually facing those situations in a controlled way. Would you be open to that?
Yes, I think that could help.
Great! We can start small. Perhaps you could aim to meet one new person at your next gathering. How does that sound?
That sounds manageable!
Perfect! Let’s also touch on your relationship with your family. You mentioned wanting to work on your patience. How has that been going?
It’s been challenging. I still find myself getting frustrated, especially with my dad.
That’s understandable. Can you share a specific situation where you felt that frustration recently?
Last week, he kept asking me the same questions about my work, and I felt like he wasn’t listening to me.
That sounds frustrating. How did you respond in that moment?
I snapped at him a bit, which I regretted afterward.
It’s important to recognize those moments. What do you think could help you respond differently next time?
Maybe I could take a deep breath before reacting or remind myself that he’s just trying to connect with me.
Those are great strategies! Practicing that pause can give you a moment to choose how to respond. Would you like to set a goal to try that in the coming week?
Yes, I’ll try that!
Wonderful! Finally, how are you feeling overall? Any new challenges or successes you want to share?
Overall, I feel more positive, but I still have moments of self-doubt, especially about my job.
That’s a common feeling. Would you like to explore those doubts further in our next session?
Yes, I think that would be helpful.
Great! I look forward to our next conversation. Keep practicing those strategies, and I’m excited to hear about your progress.
Thank you, Ellie! I appreciate your help.
You’re welcome! Take care, and see you soon!
Bye!
